revised_title: Lorica Structure and Development in Diaphanoeca grandis: A Scanning Electron Microscopy Study
tldr: The authors studied the structure and biology of the large collared flagellate Diaphanoeca grandis using scanning electron microscopy. They discovered new insights into lorica structure and development, including the two-layered nature of the lorica wall and the role of longitudinal and transverse costae in suspending the protoplast. Their findings provide valuable information for understanding other choanoflagellate species.
